I have 560ti and a quad cpu. So a middle configuration.
The game is pretty well optimized, except the 'special hair'.
On my config I can max everything except: hair on normal, depth of field on normal, SSAO on normal.
These 3 settings have big hit on performance, and except the hair, the other 2 are useless to put on high.
I can even set 2xSSAA instead of FXAA antialiasing, and the game still runs at over 40fps, and the ssaa looks really good.

In other words, the pc version shows it as polished like it should and it's worth buying original.

Ok, I had the problem with "Failed to Initialize Direct3D with current setting Options" when pressing Play and the Options in the launcher crashed it. Basically you have to turn off ExclusiveFullScreen. Don't know where there is an option to turn that off in Windows 8. So basically, you have to go into the registry under HKEY_CURRENT_USERSoftwareCrystal DynamicsTomb Raider . There, you have to create a subkey under Tomb Raider called Graphics. In Graphics you need to create a DWORD called ExclusiveFullScreen and set it to 0. There will allow to you go pass the Play problem. People have been saying to edit the registry and find such and such values. If you can't get pass the launcher, the game doesn't create any registry values, so there is nothing to edit. After you get pass the launcher and go back to the Tomb Raider registry, you will see a whole bunch of new values there.

@MiniST
Should make a tut on how to do this. The average user will probably somehow fuck this up big time but thanks so much for posting how to fix this. I got as far as finding the location where the graphics registry should be in regedit but wasn't sure what I should do after there, that makes sense to me though.

@MiniST

THAT WORKED! This fix must be spread! SPREAD SPREAD SPREAD!

A slightly easier to understand version of the fix above.

Okay, so I had the problem with "Failed to Initialize Direct3D with current setting Options" when pressing Play and the Options in the launcher crashed it. Basically you have to turn off ExclusiveFullScreen and there isn't really way to do that except through this method because the options screen would just crash the launcher!

FIX: Press the windows key + R to bring up Run and run 'regedit'. So basically, you have to go into the registry under 'HKEY_CURRENT_USER/Software/Crystal Dynamics/Tomb Raider' . There, you have to create a subkey under Tomb Raider called 'Graphics'. In Graphics you need to create a DWORD called 'ExclusiveFullScreen' and set it to 0. (Should already be set to 0).
This will allow to you go pass the Play problem. 

People have been saying to edit the registry and find such and such values. If you can't get pass the launcher, the game doesn't create any registry values, so there is nothing to edit. Ok hope this helps some, if it doesn't then you need to learn some basics of mounting and copy and paste techniques.

1. Download Torrent (and fuck all of people that tell everyone else to seed... Geezus.. people will seed if they can telling them seed makes people say fuck off and not seed)

2. Mount the sr-tombraider with mounting software, I use Daemon Tools cuz I roll like that.

3. Once mounted install game

4. Next go to the mounted image by doing the following.  START > COMPUTER > Next look for the Tomb Raider that is mounted, it will be a new virtual Drive like E: > Right Click > Open in New Window

5. See that SKIDROW Folder? 

6. Copy All of those files and put it into your original Location Usually here for Win7 "C:Program Files (x86)Square EnixTombraider

7. It will ask you if you want to Replace say yes

8. This is option but I like to do it just encase. Tombraider will probably have a shortcut on desktop. I like to delete that one and create a fresh one from the new Application Tombriader icon. 

9. Next go to your Firewall settings and block The Tombraider exe file. It might try and contact steam etc. 

10. Now Run the game from the Icon on your Desktop and you should be good. 

Good luck

About save files:  If you mess up your save files during an update, remove your installation completely.  Also remove any instance of tomb raider from regedit (go start >> search "regedit" >> Press F3 >> search for "tomb raider" >> delete all related entries.  Now your save files should work in the game again.

This game has taken too much time from me making it run at a resonable fps.
I managed to get it working, the fps are decent now.
I'm not sure if it permanent, the bug may show up again.
This is what I did:
Tombraidere.exe > Right click > Properties > Compatibility (Tab) > 'CHECK MARK' Disable display scaling on high DPI settings > Apply > OK
